properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from High Island to Freeport TX out 20 NM; Coastal waters from Freeport to Matagorda Ship Channel TX out 20 NM; Galveston Bay; Waters from Freeport to Matagorda Ship Channel TX from 20 to 60 NM; Waters from High Island to Freeport TX from 20 to 60 NM
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued January 11 at 1:12AM CST until January 11 at 3:15AM CST by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in League City has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Coastal waters from Freeport to Matagorda Ship Channel TX out 20
NM...
Coastal waters from High Island to Freeport TX out 20 NM...
Galveston Bay...
Waters from Freeport to Matagorda Ship Channel TX from 20 to 60
NM...
Waters from High Island to Freeport TX from 20 to 60 NM...

* Until 315 AM CST.

* At 110 AM CST, strong thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from the Houston Ship Channel to 25 NM south of
Matagorda, moving southeast at 25 knots.

HAZARD...Wind gusts to 40 knots.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Small craft could be damaged in briefly higher winds and
suddenly higher waves.

* Locations impacted include...
Galveston A122, Tabs Buoy F, Heald Bank, Tabs Buoy B, Burnet Bay,
Galveston 282, High Island 157, High Island A131, Galveston
Causeway, High Island 63, High Island A179, High Island A410,
Bastrop Bay, Brazos B133, Christmas Bay, Crystal Bay, East
Galveston Bay, Brazos 400, Galveston A196 and West Bay.

This warning also includes the following channel lights...

Freeport Entrance Lighted Buoy 4...
Freeport Entrance Lighted Buoy 1...
Houston Ship Channel Light 45...
Baytown Marina Channel Light 17...
Houston Ship Channel Light 130...
Houston Ship Channel Light 55...
Freeport Entrance Light 10...
Galveston Channel Lighted Buoy 1...
Houston Ship Channel Light 37 and
Freeport Harbor Light 20.
properties.instruction:
A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for southeastern
Texas...and the adjacent coastal waters.
